PokeBalls.name: Beast Ball
PokeBalls.description: A special Poké Ball designed to catch Ultra Beasts. It has a low success rate for catching others.

PokeBalls.name: Cherish Ball
PokeBalls.description: A quite rare Poké Ball that has been specially crafted to commemorate an occasion of some sort.

PokeBalls.name: Dark Ball
PokeBalls.description: A special Poké Ball that is able to catch Pokémon that already belong to a Trainer, as opposed to catching wild Pokémon only.

PokeBalls.name: Dive Ball
PokeBalls.description: A somewhat different Poké Ball that works especially well when catching Pokémon that live underwater.

PokeBalls.name: Dream Ball
PokeBalls.description: A somewhat different Poké Ball that makes it easier to catch wild Pokémon while they're asleep.

PokeBalls.name: Dusk Ball
PokeBalls.description: A somewhat different Poké Ball that makes it easier to catch wild Pokémon at night or in dark places such as caves.

PokeBalls.name: Fast Ball
PokeBalls.description: A Poké Ball that makes it easier to catch Pokémon that are usually very quick to run away.

PokeBalls.name: Friend Ball
PokeBalls.description: A strange Poké Ball that will make the wild Pokémon caught with it more friendly toward you immediately.

PokeBalls.name: Great Ball
PokeBalls.description: A good, high-performance Poké Ball that provides a higher Pokémon catch rate than a standard Poké Ball can.

PokeBalls.name: GS Ball
PokeBalls.description: A very, very mysterious Poké Ball.

PokeBalls.name: Heal Ball
PokeBalls.description: A remedial Poké Ball that restores the HP of a Pokémon caught with it and eliminates any status conditions.

PokeBalls.name: Heavy Ball
PokeBalls.description: A Poké Ball that is better than usual at catching very heavy Pokémon.

PokeBalls.name: Level Ball
PokeBalls.description: A Poké Ball that makes it easier to catch Pokémon that are at a lower level than your own Pokémon.

PokeBalls.name: Love Ball
PokeBalls.description: A Poké Ball that works best when catching a Pokémon that is of the opposite gender of your Pokémon.

PokeBalls.name: Lure Ball
PokeBalls.description: A Poké Ball that is good for catching Pokémon that you reel in with a rod while out fishing.

PokeBalls.name: Luxury Ball
PokeBalls.description: A particularly comfortable Poké Ball that makes a wild Pokémon quickly grow friendlier after being caught.

PokeBalls.name: Master Ball
PokeBalls.description: The best Poké Ball with the ultimate level of performance. With it, you will catch any wild Pokémon without fail.

PokeBalls.name: Moon Ball
PokeBalls.description: A Poké Ball that will make it easier to catch Pokémon that can evolve using a Moon Stone.

PokeBalls.name: Nest Ball
PokeBalls.description: A somewhat different Poké Ball that becomes more effective the lower the level of the wild Pokémon.

PokeBalls.name: Net Ball
PokeBalls.description: A somewhat different Poké Ball that is more effective when attempting to catch Water- or Bug-type Pokémon.

PokeBalls.name: Park Ball
PokeBalls.description: A special Poké Ball for use in Pal Park.

PokeBalls.name: Poké Ball
PokeBalls.description: A device for catching wild Pokémon. It's thrown like a ball at a Pokémon, comfortably encapsulating its target.

PokeBalls.name: Premier Ball
PokeBalls.description: A somewhat rare Poké Ball that has been specially made to commemorate an event of some sort.

PokeBalls.name: Quick Ball
PokeBalls.description: A somewhat different Poké Ball that has a more successful catch rate if used at the start of a wild encounter.

PokeBalls.name: Repeat Ball
PokeBalls.description: A somewhat different Poké Ball that works especially well on Pokémon species that have been caught before.

PokeBalls.name: Safari Ball
PokeBalls.description: A special Poké Ball that is used only in the Great Marsh. It is recognizable by the camouflage pattern decorating it.

PokeBalls.name: Snag Ball
PokeBalls.description: A type of modified Poké Ball that has been turned into a Snag Ball by use of a Snag Machine. The Snag Ball is the only type of Poké Ball which can snag an already caught Pokémon.

PokeBalls.name: Sport Ball
PokeBalls.description: A special Poké Ball that is used during the Bug-Catching Contest.

PokeBalls.name: Timer Ball
PokeBalls.description: A somewhat different Poké Ball that becomes progressively more effective at catching Pokémon the more turns that are taken in battle.

PokeBalls.name: Ultra Ball
PokeBalls.description: An ultra-high performance Poké Ball that provides a higher success rate for catching Pokémon than a Great Ball.
